t: Titles by Mick Karn [Music CD] - Amazon.com Music
s: You'll never mistake Karn's bass playing with any other player. Cannot believe I first bought the cassette forty years ago. Check JBK and Mick's other collaborations with Richard and Steve too. Mick Karn sadly missed. ... This CD has been reviewed badly in the past, not on Amazon but elsewhere ...

t: Karn, Mick - Collector's Edition - Amazon.com Music
s: And while I'd recommend seeking out the original records, there's a lot of great stuff on here that might help this serve as a fantastic introduction to Karn's work. ... Oh and what a wonderful slew of special guests on this album. You know, Mick has been on a host of brilliant work for years, ...

t: KARN,MICK - Selected - Amazon.com Music
s: A selection of tracks taken mainly from various solo albums spanning 13 years, with the exception of Lunette from the Liquid Glass album, a collaboration between Mick Karn and Japanese Drum and Bass artist Yoshihiro Hanno. It's a kind of best of from the former Japan bassist.

t: Mick Karn - The Concrete Twin (CD) - Amazon.com Music
s: Of course, his bass clarinet and other horns he adorns his cd's with are studio-treated and processed nicely, adding an almost Mingus-on-acid feel while his thick bass slithers and spirals over, under and within each tune. The influence of his bass mentor, Percy Jones, is evident everywhere, yet Mick has stamped his own brand ...

t: KARN, MICK - Bestial Cluster - Amazon.com Music
s: Now this was quite some exciting music that Mick Karn managed to produce on this CD quite a long time ago. The playing and the sound are first-rate and really it is probably the best record by any member fo Japan. ... Mr. Mark Deacon. ... I have (very rarely) in my lifetime (EVER) heard music with such passion and it's exactly what I've been looking for and knew that I would get it from this Audio ...

t: Mick Karn - More Better Different (CD) - Amazon.com Music
s: KSCOPE RELEASES SIXTH SOLO ALBUM FROM FORMER JAPAN BASSIST ON CD. Kscope are set to release 'More Better Different' from Mick Karn, former bassist with Japan, Rain Tree Crow, and Dalis Car. 'More Better Different' is Karn's sixth album and was originally released on Invisible Hands in 2004.

t: Amazon.com: Three Part Species: CDs & Vinyl
s: Als ich vom Tod von Mick Karn erfuhr war ich sehr berührt und mir fiel auf wie sehr ich seine Musik doch geliebt habe. Dann habe ich mir all seine Sachen nochmal angehört die ich von ihm habe und andere dazugekauft.
